title: Terminal sans serif?
content:
Would love some help in nailing this typeface. Getting close would be find, it's just some of those curves are curious.  
Much obliged for names, families or even links!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823151433/http:/typophile.com/files/font_80.png) | 13.94 KB |
author: dylankjones

comments.content: What is that family or style called? I can't drop 600 bucks on mockups, any recommendations? Thank you!

[Similars listed at Identifont](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823151433/http:/www.identifont.com/similar?J3V). There's also [Gridnik](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823151433/http:/www.foundrytypes.co.uk/the-foundry-typefaces/sans/params/foundry-gridnik) but 250£...  
Some more, may be more affordable: [Gerusa](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823151433/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scannerlicker/gerusa), [Scriber](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823151433/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/northernblock/scriber), [Sinclair](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823151433/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontsmith/fs_sinclair_family_ot)  
Hard to say for the family... I've actually sorted mine under "(like) blender" name... Gerusa and Scriber are both tagged as " [octogonal](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823151433/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Aoctagonal)". May be octogonal sans would be fine...
